bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J. F. Siler, August 23, 1946

div1.p: Hench informs Siler of the dates he is available to attend the meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial Association.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J. F. Siler, August 23, 1946
div1.opener:
August 23, 1946
Col. J. F. Siler, AUS
(Retired)
Secretary, Walter Reed Memorial Association
3434-34th Place, North West
Washington 16, D. C.
My dear Colonel Siler:
div1.p:
Since writing to General Kean, my plans for
October and November have become more clear. I now have
the exact schedule for the meeting in Oklahoma City,
which I am attending, and find that I can not leave in
time to attend the meeting in Chicago, November 1st.
Mrs. Hench and I have decided to go from Oklahoma City
to Colorado Springs for a week or ten days of rest; and
I have therefore decided not to accept the invitation
to speak in Chicago, November 16.

This means that I have no definite dates for
November after my return from Colorado Springs, about the
10th or the 11th. Therefore, I am at your service as far
as the meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial Association is
concerned, with the exception that I do want to be here
with my family on Thanksgiving as I haven't been home
on Thanksgiving for four years. Assuming that November 28th
is Thanksgiving (there has been so much confusion recently
about Thanksgiving) I could come any time the week of the
17th that you might choose, and I would prefer that you
set the date to suit the convenience of the others and
not to suit the convenience of the youngest, most un-
important member. I sincerely hope that nothing will
prevent me, at the last minute, from coming.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alp
P. S. If you have already tentatively set the date for the
18th or 19th, either date will be quite convenient. As I
said, any day that you set during the week of the 17th
should be convenient.
